Description: Blown-glass flask: the vessel, in the shape of a carafe, has a long cylindrical neck and dome-shaped body. The fabric is transparent pale-green glass. Sheared rim. Two heavy dark-amber rods around the neck have been worked into irregular festoons to give a good grip to the user. Intact.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Nabasha, from a burial at the east end of the mound.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie ‘et al.’, ‘Tanis’ Pt. II. ‘Nebesheh and Defenneh’ (London 1888), 24, right column, centre. H. Coutts, 'Gold of the Pharaohs', (Edinburgh 1988), p. 96 [85].
